content.question: Read the question carefully. You can receive full credit only by directly answering all aspects of the question. You must answer the question in essay form. An outline or bulleted list is not acceptable. (Note: This exam uses the chronological designations B.C.E. (before the common era) and C.E. (common era). These designations correspond to B.C. (before Christ) and A.D. (anno Domini), which are used in some art history resources.) The work shown is from the Villa of Publius Fannius Synistor at Boscoreale, near Pompeii, created c. 50–40 B.C.E. Describe at least two visual characteristics of the work. Using specific visual evidence, explain at least two ways in which the visual characteristics contribute to a sense of architectural space. Explain how the visual characteristics of the work are typical of ancient Roman wall painting.
